verb.description: (of an engine) undergo a mistimed explosion in the cylinder or exhaust.
examples: a car backfired in the road

verb.description: (of a plan or action) rebound adversely on the originator; have the opposite effect to what was intended.

noun.description: A mistimed explosion in the cylinder or exhaust of a vehicle or engine.
A fire set intentionally to arrest the progress of an approaching fire by creating a burned area in its path, thus depriving the fire of fuel.
